intro: Reseda lutea f. hispidula, commonly known as the hispid yellowweed, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial with hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive, rough texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it identifiable by its dense pubescence and characteristic floral structure.
